subject: Medicine
title: Fomite Transmission
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Fomite Transmission.

hook.text: A doorknob in a hospital can harbor live flu virus for 48 hours. Surfaces are silent accomplices.

buildup.text: Fomites are contaminated objectsâ€”phones, handrails, elevator buttonsâ€”that transfer pathogens to hands.

discovery.text: You touch your face 16 times per hour on average, transferring pathogens from surfaces to mucous membranes.

twist.text: During COVID-19, surface cleaning was overemphasized. Fomite transmission turned out to be far less common.

climax.text: Not all pathogens spread the same way. Overreacting to one route can mean underreacting to the real one.

punchline.text: Clean surfaces help, but know what really spreads.

quiz.question: What lesson did COVID-19 teach about fomite transmission?
options: Surface transmission was less important than airborne spread
Surface cleaning was the most effective prevention method
Fomites were the primary route of COVID-19 spread
